creator: skitching@apache.org
text:
When an input xml document for the xslt task contains xml entity references (eg
&foo;) for an entity that has never been defined, there is no error output
generated.

creator: skitching@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 17111
simple test case demonstrating the problem

Test case that demonstrates how processing an invalid xml file with the xslt
task generates no error output. Note that errors *are* output if the <!doctype>
tag is removed from the input file.

Sorry for the delay in responding.
This does not seem to be an ant issue.

It is the XSLT processor that ignores the unknown entity.

Marking as INVALUD.
